projects.title: Roguelike Dugeon Game
description: The last react project from freeCodeCamp. I learned a lot about how to interact with tilemap,
spirte, and generate rooms, turnels, as well as
visualize my nested array on HTML5 canvas. For a detaied description please visit my github.

projects.title: Game of Life
description: John Conway's Game of Life is a self-displayed game.
When you enter the page, the cells will start life cycle by certain rules automatically.
Some of the cells die, some of the cells just start a new life.
At any time, You may add/delete cells by click on the board, Or pause it,
clear the board and restart it. It also shows how many generations have gone by.

projects.title: Recipe Box
description: In recipe box, you can add, edit, and delete recipes.
It will show you a list of recipes when you first open it, click a bar to view the detailed recipe.
All new recipes are saved in browser's local storage.
Refresh the page will not change any stored data.

projects.title: Camper Leaderboard
description: Camper Leaderboard is an ordered list of Free Code Camp campers.
Users can view who've earned the most brownie points in the past 30 days,
how many brownie points they've earned in the past 30 days,
and how many they've earned total.
User can toggle between sorting the list by how many brownie points they've earned
in the past 30 days and by how many brownie points they've earned total.

projects.title: Git-hub flavoured Markdown Preview
description: Markdown Preview is a useful tool which coded in React.
By typing gitHub-flavored Markdown into the left text area,
the preview window will show the decoded output simultaneously.

projects.title: Simon Game
description: Simon is a game of memory skill.
User will be presented with a random series of button presses.
Click the buttons in right order will take user to next step.
If wrong button clicked, the warning will show on the top, and the last series of button will show again.
If wrong button clicked in strict mode, the game will restart from step 1.
The count window shows the current steps, press start in middle of the game will initialize the game,
and restarts at a new series of button presses. user wins the game by getting a series of 20 steps correct.

projects.title: Tic Tac Toe
description: User can play a game of Tic Tac Toe with the computer.
It will not be very easy to beat the computer since the AI has been optimized.
The game will reset as soon as it's over.

projects.title: Pomodoro Clock
description: Pomodoro Clock is a time management tool.
It breaks down work into intervals, traditionally 25 minutes in length,
seperated by short breaks. Those intervals are named pomodoros.
Users can reset and customize the length of each pomodoro. Start a pomodoro,
and the timer will go off once the setting minutes has elapsed.

projects.title: Calculator
description: Javascript Calculator can do simple math, As well as chaining mathematical operations.
It can be cleaned by click the “C” button. After click the equal button, the operation is done.
It will not memorize the result number and carry it onto the next operation.

projects.title: Twitch streamer
description: Twitch Streamer is a page of list of assorted Twitch user.
The listed information of a streamer includes avatar, streamer name, current streaming status.
If it’s streaming, the streaming title will be seen, and if it’s a closed account, the notification will be seen.
By click on a bar, it will take the user directly to the streamer’s channel in Twitch.tv.

projects.title: Wikipedia viewer
description: Wikipedia Viewer is a search page that show summaries of Wikipedia articles.
The user can also click the button on top to see a random Wikipedia entry.

projects.title: Local Weather App
description: Local Weather App shows the weather in user’s current location.
The icon and background color will change depending on the weather or the temperature.
You can toggle between Fahrenheit and Celsius by clicking the acronym(F/C).

projects.title: Random quote machine
description: Random Quote Machine shows a new random quote when click.
You can also tweet out the quote.

projects.title: Tribute Page
description: A single introduction page with images and links to external website with further information on the topic.

projects.title: Boostrap Portofolio Template
description: A bonfire challenge project for FreeCodeCamp.
Access all of the content just by scrolling.
Jump to different section by clicking buttons in the navigation.
Preview different projects and go to my social media pages by click the icons.

projects.title: Chinese go
description: Play around with code.
The idea behind Chinese Go is providing an open platform for Chinese language learners.
They can easily access their free studying source and communicate with each other.
The landing page acts as a navigation which create a new and playful experience.

projects.title: Fine line
projects.description: Bootstrap template made with as simple as possible kinda manner.

projects.title: Old protofolio 2012
description: The project helped me to get rid of the habit of relying on PSD file.
I desinged this one directly from markup Which saves a lot of time and the design is more flexible.
It is a mock-up of an award winning website, During the process, I learned more about responsive designing.

projects.title: Landing page design
description: 1. Empathy For Life is a no-kill dog shelter in Goyang Korea.
I volunteered to design their website.
2. Hanmi is an agency that introducing the plastic surgery clinics in S.Korea to Chinese tourists.
The design I created in 2010 housed plenty of information in the landing page.

projects.title: Involving and discussing the political activity
description: Involving and Discussing The Political Activity was the initial and paramount project I worked on when I was working as the web designer in a web agency in Korea.
The site was used to edit and send out text messages as well as images and videos.
It’s function oriented also mobile oriented.

projects.title: collection of coding work
description: 1. 202 is a construction interior company. The site was static and used flash for sliders in the landing page.
I designed the site in PSD then transfer the PSD file to HTML/CSS.
2. For Korean Presbyterian Church of Saipan, I did the PSD to HTML/CSS transformation.
You may visit here:  http://www.spnchurch.com/
3. Artlalla is a platform which allows the art students to sell their artworks through the site.
You may visit here:  http://www.artrella.com/
4. SMI stands for Standard Management Ins, It’s the organization that registering ISO certificates.
You may visit here:  http://www.ikmc4u.com/
